thread.title: Bambanani Mbane: Banyana Banyana Star Marries Longtime Lover Tsholofelo Makgalemele Mbane, Photos
thread.title_full: Bambanani Mbane: Banyana Banyana Star Marries Longtime Lover Tsholofelo Makgalemele Mbane, Photos

author: Raphael Abiola
title: Bambanani Mbane: Banyana Banyana Star Marries Longtime Lover Tsholofelo Makgalemele Mbane, Photos
text: Heavyweight broadcaster Robert Marawa, the voice of sports media in South Africa, celebrates 49th birthdayBoxing Banyana Banyana and Mamelodi Sundowns star Bambanani Mbane has married her longtime lover Tsholofelo Makgalemele-Mbane, in a heartwarming fashion. The 33-year-old defender's wedding ceremony with Makgalemele was held on Wednesday, December 27, 2023, in Sterkspruit, Eastern Cape. Mbane and her lover have been together since 2019 but decided to make things official between them late last year. On their wedding day, the couples were pictured in traditional attire as they showed lovely gestures to each other. She was seen feeding her wife with the wedding cake at the event, while her partner also replicated the gesture. Heavyweight broadcaster Robert Marawa, the voice of sports media in South Africa, celebrates 49th birthdayBoxing Mbane plays for the [South Africa](https://sportsbrief.com/tag/south-africa/) Women's League side, Mamelodi Sundowns, and the South Africa women's national team. She was part of the Banyana Banyana squad that won the last Africa Women's Cup of Nations in 2022 and had a stellar performance for Sundowns. According to [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bambanani_Mbane), her performance for the Masandawana and the Banyana Banyana earned her a place in the IFFHS CAF Women's Team of The Year in 2022 and the CAF Women's Africa XI in 2023. She was also part of the South Africa Women's squad that travelled to the 2023 FIFA Women's [World Cup](https://sportsbrief.com/tag/world-cup/) hosted by Australia and New Zealand, where they crashed out in Round 16. Sports Brief previously reported that [ South Africa's football prowess was rewarded](https://sportsbrief.com/football/54666-dlamini-motlhalo-5-banyana-banyana-stars-named-caf-womens-xi/) at the 2023 CAF Awards as five Banyana Banyana players were named in the Women's Team of the Year. Siphiwe Tshabalala's net worth, wife, house, current team, cars, ageFootball The stellar XI, led by the Mamelodi Sundowns duo of Andile Dlamini and Bambanani Mbane, featured Glasgow City midfielder Linda Motlhalo andDynamo Minsk defender Lebo Ramalepe. South Africa progressed into the tourney's knockout stages despite being drawn into the dangerous Group G at the 2023 FIFA Women's World Cup alongside Sweden, [Argentina](https://sportsbrief.com/facts/teams/16181-argentina-national-football-teams-players-coach-fifa-world-rankings-world-cup-more/), and Italy.
